comments.body: The fortresses are already defended by wither skeletons, skeletons and blazes.
Wow
Good Idea, but then it would be even more difficult to spot the fortresses.

This DOES require stash-of-a-kind items, so this may require to add in stuff that can only get in commands, creative, and stashes. Like for instance Instant healing III or IV. Maybe those can even me brewed! But anyway, if you do not want to add new stuff, it can just be endgame items (like nether star or even beacon)
Bruh these sound legit op
Yes! Minecraft needs stashes!

INFO BOOTH

These ARE supposed to be OP if you can get through them. Medium stashes may contain diamonds (maybe a few) These are supposed to be balanced. They ARE rare, and the ancient blocks cannot be moved except by the ancient piston, which is a component for a few of the variety of secret enterances. This is supposed to add many things. I would of just done this in a mod, but I''m no coder. People have been itchng for a cave update, right? The secret enterances are always exposed, along with the puzzle or hidden activator (button, levers, etc.) This secret enterance is often in a cave. Not many of the secret stashes are found above ground.

Also, all stashes can contain lethal traps. Mojang can decide how these traps work, and what they are (and whether to add new ones) if this makes it to popularity (chances are it won't) Smaller the stash, less lethal traps. Small stashes contain 1-3 lethal traps, and 3-5 non-lethal traps. Medium stashes contain 3-6 lethals and 4-7 non- lethals. Large stashes contain from 7 up to 10 lethal traps, and 10-15 non-lethal traps.

Beware that non-lethal traps could be lethal, if you're on very low HP. These are designed to take a few points of HP if they hit you. Examples would be a 5 second poison I arrow/potion trap. A "deadlier" non-lethal would be a harming I arrow trap. Lethals will kill you unless you have a special type of thing on you

 

I did also just realise it may be hard to disable all the traps, so maybe just create a "back door"?

INFO:

 

Lethal traps kill if you are not good enough...

For instance, lava pit. You can mine your way out if you have fire resistance. Let's pretend that mojang added a new trap. 

Also...

All the traps, blocks, EVERYTHING in the secret stashes is made of this ancient block. (no, this stuff isn't available via creative) This ancient block cannot be mined, exploded, etc. It CAN be mined in creative mode.

Also be aware that the bigger the stash, the harder it is to find the enterance. 

Also Also, the rareness of the stashes combined is about as rare as a abandoned mineshaft.

 

ONE MORE THING!

 

How to tell the difference between how large the stash is. Also stay to hear the makebelieve story of minecraft past.

1. Sizes. Usually large stashes have an extra floor, and medium is longer/bigger in general

2. Banners. There we three kingdoms long ago... Each made stashes. The largest and wealthiest of these kingdoms was called Kalles-Kia, the smallest one with not as much wealth is called Jayes-Jia and the kingdom in the middle of the two was called Quesi-Qia. Kalles-Kia was foolish and made very few stashes, each stash containing a hefty chunk of their riches. In the end, they didn't have many riches left, and they had made their puzzles using a Jazzly, an incredibly smart being who could make REALLY good puzzles. Such creatures don't exist anymore. Many of their kingdom lost their lives trying to figure the puzzles. Continued in the next comment!

INFO:

 

The other two kingdoms didn't use Jazzlies. They made the puzzles and hidden enterances themselves. Quesi-Qia expended treasure in good amounts, but made sure they had some left. The smallest kingdom, Jayes-Jia, had lots of stashes, not exactly the best guarded and concealed, but it meant people won't die as often. Each kingdom put banners in their stashes, to tell each other which is which. You can find two in each room with traps in it, and one in the treasure room. Jayes-Jia has lime banners, with the black face of a creeper on it. Quesi-Qia has a black banner, with a white cross through it. Kalles-Kia has a half-half banner. The top half is red, and the bottom half is yellow. The clans have all died out by now, first Kalles-Kia, followed by Jayes-Jia, then Quesi-Qia. It's safe to collet their treasures... If you dare to pass the traps!
also perhaps the previously mentioned infernal bug would be coming out of this portal

I saw a general post (removed being a ‘better dungeons’ snip) touching on the idea of traps. So there is TNT in the floor? How does this trap operate? What’s the triggering mechanism & how do you avoid the player cutting one wire to disable it? Keep in mind a player can mine from any direction, but as in all things in life they may normally opt for the path of least resistance.

WE NEED NEW DUNGEONS I HATE A ROOM THAT A 5X5 AND HAS 2 CHEST!

This this is a cool idea, but the problem of not being able to play with others is still there for some. Maybe these structures could only generate in unexplored chunks if another player joins the game, but if there are dungeons that require teamwork, then there should be solo dungeons as well.
@Jeff Steve well there would probably be other dungeons for those who can't join other players, but the team dungeons will add some fun and specific for friends to explore
What are your thoughts on this structure?

I like the concept of the workshop, and the loot tables are balanced. However, I don't think the tall stairs should have a spawner. Maybe it could be a vertical shaft/parkour challenge over lava, rigged with traps that attempt to knock the player to his/her doom.
yes but i want to stick with the Mojang Basics But they can change it up if this gets added with the other 2. Just saying also thank you for the nice comment.

stone shore is a beach made out of stone
Just use a pickaxe bro
I think this makes sense because why would pirates bury it in the stone? They would bury it in the sand.

I agree. It's very frustrating when I am looking for a chest, and I have to mine through stone, sometimes while fighting drowned and trying not to drown. Also, unless they were enderman pirates that teleported it down there, how would the pirates get it beneath the stone? They would put it in the sand.
Maybe we could keep them, but make some better loot for it?

This idea is unique and interesting, but I feel like it would ruin the character of the game. This could work in a mod though.
They should have obsidian stairs leading up to the top on the tallest ones

Not bad of an idea, but they should keep these stuff in minecraft doungeons and also having a structure with a currupted beacon may make it op

maybe when you light the flint and steel it has a 5 second cool down so you have time to get away

Staying away from it is trivial since Nether portals aren't naturally generated. And would being pulled in be that big of a deal anyway? I guess it could be a problem if there's a Ghast right there which immediately shoots at you, but I don't remember that ever happening to me even when properly equipped to handle it.
Naturally generated portals have a netherrac layer underneath. It follows that the portal is PUSHING this rock out of the Nether.
369199648872 Then they will not generate in soul sand valleys

Wdym by 'cuts through itself'?

 

I am pretty sure that they only spawn in the Wastes anyway...

No, they also spawn in soul sand valley and probably also basalt deltas. And by "cuts through itself" I mean that for example a bridge generates at the bottom and goes through a corridor, but the air blocks are not generated.
So basically dungeons?

there allready this, its called mansions and pillrger outposts, sorry but i'm not up got this

There are already zombie villages that you can find rarely in-game. Basically all of the doors are broken, theres cobwebs around, and all of the villagers are replaced with zombie villagers. Although, I do like the idea of a more hostile village, like maybe have a raided village where the buildings are half burned down and there's some pillagers left over. Or perhaps a witch village in swamps? It could be interesting.
Why change completely fine system?
Spawners are very useful. For one thing, lots of adventure maps use them.
Spawners are super useful, for mob farms and XP farms especially
I get what you are saying, that structures would look better without a spawner in them. I don't think that spawners should be removed from the game entirely, however.
You're right. It is worth removing the unbalanced eternal source of resources and experience from survival. Or make its resource limited, and when it expires, it explodes.

I was thinking about the same thing, that these mansions would have blocks like their surroundings like a mansion in the crimson forest would have crimson hyphae, cobblestone, nether bricks, crimson logs and planks and some huge crimson fungi surrounding it.

Not to mention that the mobs can be all the nether mobs except blaze and wither skeletons.

and since the new update came I think that piglins would be more of a type of mob that could be added in those mansions instead of pigmen.
